Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I’ve only just started on Letrozole. The first month I was given Crescent brand and now just collected Dr Reddys from chemist. No problems up to now, touch wood, but I know it’s early days. Found this link about pricing which might be useful.  https://bnf.nice.org.uk/medicinal-forms/letrozole.html  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole/Femara

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, here until the end of December, if all goes to plan. Weekly Taxol number 9 this week. Not been too bad up to now but starting to feel the effects. Really tired, upset stomach, tingly hands and feet. Also now developed rash on back of hands. They’ve given me antihistamines but they’re not doing much. Fed up now, just want it done with.  Lots of love to everyone going through this c**p xxx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Ariesgirl , I’ll look for the cream and ask about the steroids. I’m using dark nail varnish and so far so good. The rash seems worse when I’m hot and only on my hands at the moment.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, sorry to hear there's lots of nasty side effects around. Hopefully you'll start to pick up soon. There is a light at the end of the tunnel.  I've conpleted 3 lots of EC and 10 out of 12 weekly Taxol. Onco rang me yesterday to say he doesn't want me to have the final 2 Taxol. My hands are still sore from a rash and he thinks my body has had enough. He's happy for me to stop early, saying will be minuscule difference and not to worry. Mixed feelings really, glad to finish chemo but also I failed to get to the end. Anyway, good news is I might be able to taste my Christmas dinner.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi kiwi_h , I struggled sleeping on day 1 of Taxol, because of the steroids. Afterwards not too bad, but since diagnosis I’ve not slept well really. I think you’re right about stress playing a part. I fall asleep in no time but then wake up in the early hours and my mind goes into overdrive. Takes ages for me to switch off. Don’t think it was the Taxol for me but might be worth a chat with your team.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I’ve got a rash on the back of my hands, presumably from the weekly Taxol. Given antihistamines and hydrocortisone cream. Not really helping much, trying to moisturise lots. Seeing onco on Tuesday.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Mrs50 and Sept78  I’ve just finished 13 lots of chemo, 3 EC and 10 weekly Taxol. I had a picc line put in before the chemo started and it’s been a godsend. Had no problems with it and it’s saved the veins in my arm and avoided having lots of needles. They have been able to get my weekly bloods through it too. I don’t know why it isn’t offered to everyone. I think the Hickman line is more invasive, although I don’t have any experience of that. Going tomorrow for my picc line removing which seems to be a minor procedure.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, just read the post from Maggiemee and found it so helpful. My lumpectomy is on Friday but I'm more worried about results day which isn't until 18th June. At this point they're saying it's small and couldn't see anything in the lymph nodes on the ultrasound. I know they won't know for definite until they operate but just holding onto that. Don't know all the terms yet but ER+ and HER2 borderline, so retesting that. Scary times but this forum is amazing with some wonderful people.  Lots of love xxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: ali owl Just seen your post. Sorry to hear your news. You’ve been through enough already. Thinking of you  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: My op was on the 1st June. Went in at 7am and home around 3.30pm the same day. My first operation and it was definitely nothing to worry about. There was no sickness afterwards, anaesthetics are so good nowadays. I had a bit of a problem the next day with a small haematoma but no further surgery was needed and it will just go away on its own. Not too much pain, I just needed paracetamol. I have been doing the recommended exercises and have full movement in my arm (I had 4 lymph nodes removed). It is really doable. I'm very squeamish and I wouldn't say it was okay if it wasn't. Please message me if you want to chat. Sounds like I'm just one stage ahead of you in our treatment. We can compare notes!  Karen xx
Posts.Title: After Results

Posts.Content: Hi Pointer, I was diagnosed at the beginning of May with small tumour and no sign in lymph nodes. I've now had a lumpectomy and my post op results. The doctor told me the lump was totally removed with clear margins and nothing in lymph nodes. I kept worrying it was spreading while I waited for the operation but the doctor kept reassuring me it doesn't work like that and he was right! I'm waiting for the results now from the Oncotype test to see if I need chemo to stop any recurrence. It's all a waiting game but try and just take one step at a time and you'll get through it. It's rubbish we've had this diagnosis but it's a good result, if you know what I mean! Keep thinking it's caught early and it's treatable. Loads of help on this forum. Lots of love  Karen xx
Posts.Title: After Results

Posts.Content: Hi Aliowl, thanks for the welcome. Sorry you're not feeling great today. It does seem to be a real rollercoaster this chemo c**p. I think you're a fellow Sheffielder so might catch up with you in lovely Weston Park. Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, any more room in your chemo club? Had confirmation starting EC x 3 and then 12 weekly Taxol. Picc line and chemo chat booked for 31st July and first chemo 2nd August. Apparently my tumour, now all gone and clear lymph nodes, is a mix of ER positive and negative. So chemo recommended and then hormone therapy later. Still getting my head straight but absolutely terrified about chemo. Tried to look at chemo tips but blog not available. Any suggestions what I should take with me on the day? Thanks all, didn't want to join your club but here I am.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for all your advice. Doesn't sound quite so scary! Hubby will come with me but I'll see if I can manage on my own for future visits. Just want to get on with it now. Sooner I start, sooner I finish.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Aliowl, sorry you've had a rubbish few days. Glad you're feeling better now. Going for my picc line on Tuesday and first chemo on Thursday. Will ask about the injections. I've a long list of questions for them! Scary but want to get moving now. Every little ache I get makes me think there's something wrong. Keep well,  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi there, I had lumpectomy on 1st June. Good results, all clear and no sign in lymph nodes. I'm now waiting for result of Oncotype test which should be 10th July. I was really positive after my results that I was cancer free and all looking good. After seeing the oncologist and talking about the Oncotype I'm on a bit of a downer again, fretting about chemo. I think we all feel the same, it's such a rollercoaster of emotions. I haven't gone back to work yet. I want to see what's next and take it from there. We will get through it all, one step at a time, Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx Test

Posts.Content: Hi Hallam001 I had something similar after my WLE. I went to the dressings clinic and they said it was one of the internal dissolvable stitches which had worked its way to the surface. Removed it with tweezers and gave me some moisturiser. All fine now.  Wishing you all the best xx
Posts.Title: Post op complications

Posts.Content: Hi, I read a post ages ago where someone suggested massaging Vicks Vapour rub into nails. Might be worth trying, every little helps. Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Hand nails turning black from chemotherapy. Any advice please?

Posts.Content: Hi kathleen37 I have only just started on Letrozole and Bisphosphonates. No problems so far, touch wood! My GP has given me a prescription for Adcal which is a calcium and vitamin D3 supplement. You have to take 4 tablets per day but you swallow them so might be better than the chewable ones.  Lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole side effects - solutions??
